intro: Poljakanthema, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, succulent leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions. Poljakanthema is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh conditions.
